title: [network.informatica.com] The login form XSS via the referer value
steps: Observe the JavaScript execution in the victim's browser
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via the referer parameter in the login form of network.informatica.com. The referer value is inserted into JavaScript code without proper validation, allowing an attacker to inject malicious JavaScript that will be executed in the victim's browser when they visit a specially crafted URL.
reason: This vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves a common XSS pattern where user input is directly inserted into JavaScript code without sanitization. The attack does not require multiple components, complex state manipulation, or novel logic. The interaction is obvious once the referer parameter is identified as being used in JavaScript code.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves an XSS attack via the referer parameter in the login form, which is not directly related to authentication or authorization bypass. The methodology described focuses on testing authentication and authorization boundaries by swapping user sessions and resource IDs, not on detecting XSS vulnerabilities.
